comment: She always seems pleasant and posts all these things about being happy and stress-free. But it really feels disingenuous when she does things such as gives 0's on assignments I entirely did and followed instructions to a T. It's the fourth week right now and I have had multiple problems with this class each week.

She replaced my prof in the middle of the semester. We used Achieve and iClicker for the class. She adhered to the previous syllabus left by the first prof. The class was easy to maneuver and she was accessible if you had any questions.

Honestly, the work load for this class wasn't hard AT ALL. The professor really wants you to enjoy the class and succeed. I didn't struggle very much throughout this class and I actually enjoyed what I was learning.

Dr. Gilbert was my favorite professor at KSU. I took her class online, and I was surprised at how much I was able to learn from an online class. She grades everything promptly, is understanding of late work, and actually gives feedback. Shes honestly the dream professor to have. If you can manage a spot in one of her classes, take it.

This professor is amazing!! The class itself is pretty easy. It consists of a few discussion posts a week, Mindtap, and a few papers. Nothing too crazy whatsoever. She genuinely wants her students to succeed and overall I really enjoyed this class. I hope I can take her for some future classes.

Dr. Gilbert is one of my favorite professors at KSU. She really goes above & beyond for her students. For example, I am in the process of landing an internship with a Clinical Psychologist. Not only did she offer to be my reference, but she actually called the establishment while she was out of the country! Put in the time & you will learn a lot!

I really enjoyed taking this class online. If you put effort into it then you should definitely pass. Grades consisted mostly of discussion/reflection posts and MindTap activities. The discussions arent difficult and the professor isnt a tough grader at all. There was also a final project which wasnt too difficult.

Wasn't a difficult class, mostly discussion posts and a few papers but overall a solid class. I would like to take another class with Professor Gilbert, as she is very nice and respectful. She responds well and quickly to emails and is accessible when needed about different assignments.

Dr. Gilbert is by far one of the best professors I have had so far at KSU. She teaches online-only courses from her home in Montana, I believe. She truly cares for her students. She always provides great feedback and typically responds to emails/calls within 24 hours or less. She teaches both LDRS and PSYC courses. 10/10 will be taking her again!
